title: Use case example: Descriptive Statistics
text: qes_crop_2007_2010 excluded year-trend tables/plots contain row-level year field.

what: Table 1: sovereignty support by study period
title: Use case example: Evolution of Sovereignty Attitudes
text: Sovereignty support study period

title: Use case example: Evolution of Sovereignty Attitudes
text: sovereignty trend uses dedicated sovereignty item study. qes_crop_2007_2010 study split 2007, 2008, 2009, 2010 using collection-wave date variable. Confidence intervals binomial 95% intervals using normal approximation. n_with_measure table shows coverage thinner.

title: Use case example: Vote Choice Over Time
text: Major-party vote-choice shares year

title: Use case example: Vote Choice Over Time
text: Shares use respondents non-missing vote_choice value. Years 2009 2010 come qes_crop_2007_2010 splitting collection year. Confidence intervals binomial 95% intervals (normal approximation). trend figure restricted CAQ/ADQ, PLQ, PQ, QS, PCQ.

what: Tableau 1 : parts de choix de vote par annee
title: Exemple de cas d'usage : évolution du choix de vote
text: Parts de choix de vote des principaux partis par annee

title: Exemple de cas d'usage : évolution du choix de vote
text: Les parts utilisent les répondants avec une valeur non manquante de vote_choice. Les années 2009 et 2010 proviennent de qes_crop_2007_2010 après ventilation par année de collecte. Les intervalles de confiance sont des IC95 binomiaux (approximation normale). La figure est limitée à la CAQ/ADQ, au PLQ, au PQ, à QS et au PCQ.

title: Exemple de cas d'usage : statistiques descriptives
text: Taille d’échantillon par étude

title: Exemple de cas d'usage : statistiques descriptives
text: Répartition des groupes d’âge par année

title: Exemple de cas d'usage : statistiques descriptives
text: Indicateur de participation par année

title: Exemple de cas d'usage : statistiques descriptives
text: qes_crop_2007_2010 est exclu des tableaux et graphiques par année parce que ce fichier ne contient pas d’année au niveau des répondants.

what: Tableau 1 : appui a la souverainete par periode d’etude
title: Exemple de cas d'usage : évolution des attitudes liées à la souveraineté
text: Appui la souverainete par periode d’etude

title: Exemple de cas d'usage : évolution des attitudes liées à la souveraineté
text: La tendance utilise la question directe sur la souverainete de chaque etude. Le jeu qes_crop_2007_2010 est ventile en 2007, 2008, 2009 et 2010 partir de sa variable de date de collecte. Les intervalles de confiance sont des IC95 binomiaux (approximation normale). La colonne N avec item souverainete indique la couverture disponible selon la periode.

title: Démarrage avec qesR
code: if (!requireNamespace("devtools", quietly = TRUE)) install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("ThomasGareau/qesR") library(qesR)

title: Démarrage avec qesR
text: get_qescodes() : liste des codes d’études get_qes("qes2022") : téléchargement d’une étude get_codebook("qes2022") : codebook get_preview("qes2022", 10) : aperçu rapide get_question(obj, variable) : texte de question get_qes_master() : données fusionnées harmonisées

title: Démarrage avec qesR
code: codes <- get_qescodes(detailed = TRUE) qes2022 <- get_qes("qes2022") cb <- get_codebook("qes2022") master <- get_qes_master(strict = FALSE)

title: Démarrage avec qesR
text: Voir aussi : Données fusionnées : fr-donnees-fusionnees Citations : fr-citations-etudes Exemples de cas d’usage : fr-analyse-souverainete, fr-analyse-descriptive

title: Données fusionnées harmonisées
code: library(qesR)  master <- get_qes_master(strict = FALSE) dim(master) head(master)

title: Données fusionnées harmonisées
text: Colonnes harmonisées actuelles de qes_master : qes_code, qes_year, qes_name_en, respondent_id, interview_start, interview_end, interview_recorded, language, citizenship, year_of_birth, age, age_group, gender, province_territory, education, income, religion, born_canada, political_interest, ideology, turnout, vote_choice, vote_choice_text, party_best, party_lean, sovereignty_support, sovereignty, federal_pid, provincial_pid, survey_weight, definibin, ethn1, influperso, luentend, occup, patron, pondam1, issue_family_support, info_source_primary, info_source_secondary, party_best_health, identity_self_1, identity_self_2, referendum_intent, party_best_anticorruption, elites_out_of_touch, trust_government, gov_tax_waste, issue_education, feeling_qs_0_100, election_timing_eval, pr_reform_support, democracy_needs_parties, parties_all_same, feeling_charest_0_100, qc_difference_view, feeling_boisclair_0_100, feeling_dumont_0_100, feeling_david_0_100, feeling_mckay_0_100, leader_most_competent, fed_gov_too_interventionist, leader_closest_people, qc_economy_change, federalist_sovereignist_self, future_outlook, privatize_hydro_support, private_healthcare_support, gov_role_environment, profits_help_poor, party_best_health_alt, powers_for_quebec, party_best_environment, party_best_poverty, qc_voice_federal, party_best_qc_identity, party_best_caisse_depot, decision_level_a, decision_level_b, feeling_unions_0_100, feeling_business_0_100, same_sex_marriage, family_values_priority, issue_tax_cuts, provincial_pid_item, provincial_party_lean, party_named, vote_federal_2006, employment_status, issue_qc_status, home_language, gov_role_jobs_income, issue_poverty, vote_reason_1, vote_reason_2, interview_weekday, gov_satisfaction, polling_trust, polls_eval, previous_vote_2003 La fusion applique aussi : une normalisation des valeurs pour rendre les réponses comparables la dérivation de age_group lorsque l’âge ou l’année de naissance est disponible la conservation des répondants panel et non-panel (pas de fusion entre études) le renommage explicite des variables héritées opaques (par ex. q10, q16, voteprec) vers des noms lisibles le suivi de la provenance via attr(master, "source_map") la liste des variables inter-études ajoutées via attr(master, "crossstudy_variables_added") la table de correspondance anciens/nouveaux noms via attr(master, "variable_name_map") La déduplication s’applique uniquement à l’intérieur d’un même code d’étude (pas entre enquêtes panel et non-panel).
code: name_map <- attr(master, "variable_name_map") head(name_map)

title: Données fusionnées harmonisées
code: get_qes_master(save_path = "qes_master.csv", strict = FALSE) get_qes_master(save_path = "qes_master.rds", strict = FALSE)

title: Getting Started with qesR
code: if (!requireNamespace("remotes", quietly = TRUE)) install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("ThomasGareau/qesR") library(qesR)

title: Getting Started with qesR
text: Core calls: get_qes(srvy) download survey code get_qescodes() list available codes get_preview(srvy, obs) preview observations get_question(data, variable) retrieve survey question text get_codebook(srvy) retrieve codebook get_qes_master() build merged harmonized data

title: Getting Started with qesR
code: get_qescodes() get_qescodes(detailed = TRUE)

title: Getting Started with qesR
code: qes2022 <- get_qes("qes2022") names(qes2022)[1:20]

what: Retrieve the codebook in different layouts
title: Getting Started with qesR
code: cb_compact <- get_codebook("qes2022", layout = "compact") cb_wide <- get_codebook("qes2022", layout = "wide") cb_long <- get_codebook("qes2022", layout = "long")

what: Get a preview and question text
title: Getting Started with qesR
code: get_preview("qes2022", 10) get_question(qes2022, "cps_age_in_years") get_question(qes2022, "cps_age_in_years", full = TRUE)

title: Getting Started with qesR
code: master <- get_qes_master(   surveys = c("qes2022", "qes2018", "qes2014", "qes2007", "qes1998"),   strict = FALSE )  dim(master) head(master)

title: Getting Started with qesR
text: Surveys loaded labelled form available variable/value labels. Codebook metadata can inspected compact, wide, long layout. Merged data includes harmonized variables, de-duplication, source-map tracing.

title: Getting Started with qesR
code: get_qes_master(save_path = "qes_master.csv", strict = FALSE) get_qes_master(save_path = "qes_master.rds", strict = FALSE)

title: Merged Dataset Workflow
code: library(qesR)  master <- get_qes_master(strict = FALSE) dim(master) head(master)

title: Merged Dataset Workflow
text: Current harmonized columns qes_master: qes_code, qes_year, qes_name_en, respondent_id, interview_start, interview_end, interview_recorded, language, citizenship, year_of_birth, age, age_group, gender, province_territory, education, income, religion, born_canada, political_interest, ideology, turnout, vote_choice, vote_choice_text, party_best, party_lean, sovereignty_support, sovereignty, federal_pid, provincial_pid, survey_weight, definibin, ethn1, influperso, luentend, occup, patron, pondam1, issue_family_support, info_source_primary, info_source_secondary, party_best_health, identity_self_1, identity_self_2, referendum_intent, party_best_anticorruption, elites_out_of_touch, trust_government, gov_tax_waste, issue_education, feeling_qs_0_100, election_timing_eval, pr_reform_support, democracy_needs_parties, parties_all_same, feeling_charest_0_100, qc_difference_view, feeling_boisclair_0_100, feeling_dumont_0_100, feeling_david_0_100, feeling_mckay_0_100, leader_most_competent, fed_gov_too_interventionist, leader_closest_people, qc_economy_change, federalist_sovereignist_self, future_outlook, privatize_hydro_support, private_healthcare_support, gov_role_environment, profits_help_poor, party_best_health_alt, powers_for_quebec, party_best_environment, party_best_poverty, qc_voice_federal, party_best_qc_identity, party_best_caisse_depot, decision_level_a, decision_level_b, feeling_unions_0_100, feeling_business_0_100, same_sex_marriage, family_values_priority, issue_tax_cuts, provincial_pid_item, provincial_party_lean, party_named, vote_federal_2006, employment_status, issue_qc_status, home_language, gov_role_jobs_income, issue_poverty, vote_reason_1, vote_reason_2, interview_weekday, gov_satisfaction, polling_trust, polls_eval, previous_vote_2003 get_qes_master() also keeps merge logic explicit: uses cross-study variable maps value normalization comparability derives age_group age year--birth available retains panel non-panel respondents separate observations renames opaque legacy variables (example q10, q16, voteprec) readable merged names stores source-variable provenance attr(master, "source_map") stores list added cross-study variables attr(master, "crossstudy_variables_added") stores old--new variable renaming attr(master, "variable_name_map") also records source-variable provenance:
code: source_map <- attr(master, "source_map") head(source_map) name_map <- attr(master, "variable_name_map") head(name_map)

title: Merged Dataset Workflow
text: get_qes_master() applies: respondent de-duplication within survey code derived age groups age year--birth available removal rows empty across harmonized variables

title: Merged Dataset Workflow
code: get_qes_master(save_path = "qes_master.csv", strict = FALSE) get_qes_master(save_path = "qes_master.rds", strict = FALSE)

title: qesR
text: Install development version GitHub:
code: if (!requireNamespace("devtools", quietly = TRUE)) install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("ThomasGareau/qesR")

title: qesR
text: package provides access QES surveys : get_qes(srvy): download survey code get_qescodes(): list survey codes metadata get_preview(srvy, obs): preview survey get_question(data, variable): retrieve question text get_codebook(srvy): get survey codebook get_qes_master(): build harmonized merged dataset

title: qesR
code: library(qesR)  # list survey call codes get_qescodes()  # load one survey qes2022 <- get_qes("qes2022")  # preview observations get_preview("qes2022", 10)  # retrieve question text get_question(qes2022, "cps_age_in_years", full = TRUE)  # build merged cross-study dataset master <- get_qes_master(strict = FALSE) head(master)

title: qesR
text: downloaded survey files read returned labelled form codebook metadata attached available get_codebook() merged dataset creation includes harmonization, de-duplication, filtering empty rows source-variable provenance available via attr(master, "source_map")

title: qesR
text: qesR includes merged harmonized dataset workflow: harmonizes: Current harmonized columns qes_master: qes_code, qes_year, qes_name_en, respondent_id, interview_start, interview_end, interview_recorded, language, citizenship, year_of_birth, age, age_group, gender, province_territory, education, income, religion, born_canada, political_interest, ideology, turnout, vote_choice, vote_choice_text, party_best, party_lean, sovereignty_support, sovereignty, federal_pid, provincial_pid, survey_weight, definibin, ethn1, influperso, luentend, occup, patron, pondam1, issue_family_support, info_source_primary, info_source_secondary, party_best_health, identity_self_1, identity_self_2, referendum_intent, party_best_anticorruption, elites_out_of_touch, trust_government, gov_tax_waste, issue_education, feeling_qs_0_100, election_timing_eval, pr_reform_support, democracy_needs_parties, parties_all_same, feeling_charest_0_100, qc_difference_view, feeling_boisclair_0_100, feeling_dumont_0_100, feeling_david_0_100, feeling_mckay_0_100, leader_most_competent, fed_gov_too_interventionist, leader_closest_people, qc_economy_change, federalist_sovereignist_self, future_outlook, privatize_hydro_support, private_healthcare_support, gov_role_environment, profits_help_poor, party_best_health_alt, powers_for_quebec, party_best_environment, party_best_poverty, qc_voice_federal, party_best_qc_identity, party_best_caisse_depot, decision_level_a, decision_level_b, feeling_unions_0_100, feeling_business_0_100, same_sex_marriage, family_values_priority, issue_tax_cuts, provincial_pid_item, provincial_party_lean, party_named, vote_federal_2006, employment_status, issue_qc_status, home_language, gov_role_jobs_income, issue_poverty, vote_reason_1, vote_reason_2, interview_weekday, gov_satisfaction, polling_trust, polls_eval, previous_vote_2003 Harmonization applies value normalization, derived age groups, within-study de-duplication, removal rows empty across harmonized variables. Opaque legacy variables (example q10, q16, voteprec) renamed readable merged names. old--new mapping available via attr(master, "variable_name_map") saved sidecar file qes_master_variable_name_map.csv. See: Merged Dataset
code: get_qes_master(save_path = "qes_master.csv", strict = FALSE) get_qes_master(save_path = "qes_master.rds", strict = FALSE)

what: Build a Harmonized Stacked Master QES Dataset — get_qes_master
title: Build a Harmonized Stacked Master QES Dataset — get_qes_master
text: Downloads multiple Quebec Election Study datasets, harmonizes shared variables, stacks rows one master data frame, de-duplicates respondents within survey code, drops rows empty across harmonized variables.

title: Build a Harmonized Stacked Master QES Dataset — get_qes_master
code: get_qes_master(   surveys = NULL,   assign_global = TRUE,   object_name = "qes_master",   quiet = FALSE,   strict = FALSE,   save_path = NULL )

title: Build a Harmonized Stacked Master QES Dataset — get_qes_master
text: surveys Character vector qesR survey codes. Defaults studies get_qescodes(). assign_global TRUE, assign result .GlobalEnv using object_name. object_name Object name used assign_global = TRUE. Defaults "qes_master". quiet TRUE, suppress informational output downloading. strict TRUE, stop study fails. FALSE, return partial results record failures attributes. save_path Optional output path writing master file. Use .rds RDS output; otherwise CSV written. opaque legacy variables renamed merged output, old--new variable map also written alongside saved file.

title: Build a Harmonized Stacked Master QES Dataset — get_qes_master
text: harmonized stacked data frame attributes: source_map, loaded_surveys, failed_surveys, harmonized_variables. Additional attributes duplicates_removed, empty_rows_removed, variable_name_map report row filtering renaming details. save_path provided, output path stored saved_to; renaming applied, sidecar mapping file path stored variable_name_map_path.

title: qesR 0.4.4
text: Added get_qes_master() harmonized merged datasets across QES studies. Added merge quality controls: within-year respondent de-duplication -empty-row removal. Added broader harmonization age, age group, education, turnout, vote choice, weights. Renamed opaque legacy merged variables (e.g., q10, q16, voteprec) readable names added transparent old--new mapping via variable_name_map. Added variable-name mapping sidecar output (*_variable_name_map.csv) saving/building merged datasets. Improved codebook workflows compact/wide/long layouts value-label extraction helpers. Updated researcher website use-case figures clearer year-axis labeling, dynamic y-axis bounds, expandable full code blocks reproducibility. Added researcher website content merged-dataset documentation, study citations, analysis examples.

title: qesR 0.4.3
text: Added get_question(..., full = TRUE) support richer question-text recovery. Improved codebook metadata parsing handling support files.

title: qesR 0.4.2
text: Expanded QES catalog entries Dataverse file selection behavior.
